channel.title: People can't connect to my server
channel.description: No one can connect to my server, but about 3 hours ago everyone could. I have changed nothing on my server, client, portforward settings, etc. It just cut everyone off. This doesn't really make sense, but mabye one of you have experinece this problem and know how to fix it.

item.title: People can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

[quote=“TimeRS3, post:2, topic:444507”]yeh happened to me 2wice usually the problem is if you using no-ip its expired or your if you go to cmd>ipconfig your
ip probably changed the one you use on router to port it

im not sure if im entirely rite try it though port again[/quote]
Nice signature

OT:
Out of curiosity.
If you figure out why your ip changed…
I’d like to know to avoid this xD

Read full topic
item.source: People can't connect to my server

item.title: People can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“qtst35, post:8, topic:444507”]check if you ip has changed.

sometimes your ip changes and u have to make a static ip adress.
if it has you have to re port forward with your new ip address[/quote][quote=“runescape sucks, post:7, topic:444507”]I found the problem, it was my external IP that randomly changed.[/quote]

Read full topic

sometimes your ip changes and u have to make a static ip adress.
if it has you have to re port forward with your new ip address

item.title: People can't connect to my server

item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I found the problem, it was my external IP that randomly changed.

Read full topic
item.source: People can't connect to my server

item.title: People can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Go to your firewall options and make sure its allowing the port your server is running on (prob 43594), then go to http://canyouseeme.org/ on the hosters computer & type the port in. If it says success the server is online & there is a client issue.

Read full topic
item.source: People can't connect to my server

item.title: People can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“TimeRS3, post:4, topic:444507”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=547198.msg4011643#msg4011643 date=1339274426]

yeh happened to me 2wice usually the problem is if you using no-ip its expired or your if you go to cmd>ipconfig your
ip probably changed the one you use on router to port it

im not sure if im entirely rite try it though port again

I didn’t use No-IP for my client, I used my external IP. I only used No-IP as a way to hide my IP on the server status pages
[/quote]

i see but my second thing i said still matters though if your portforwarding changed on its own some how so try that happens to me sometimes[/quote]
Nope, my IP didn’t change. Still have no idea why this is happening

Read full topic

yeh happened to me 2wice usually the problem is if you using no-ip its expired or your if you go to cmd>ipconfig your
ip probably changed the one you use on router to port it

im not sure if im entirely rite try it though port again
[/quote]
I didn’t use No-IP for my client, I used my external IP. I only used No-IP as a way to hide my IP on the server status pages[/quote]

i see but my second thing i said still matters though if your portforwarding changed on its own some how so try that happens to me sometimes

item.title: People can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“TimeRS3, post:2, topic:444507”]yeh happened to me 2wice usually the problem is if you using no-ip its expired or your if you go to cmd>ipconfig your
ip probably changed the one you use on router to port it

im not sure if im entirely rite try it though port again[/quote]
I didn’t use No-IP for my client, I used my external IP. I only used No-IP as a way to hide my IP on the server status pages
